result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wade Darrin Davids

records.addlTxt: Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 17, Judge Stark. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial.  Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 17.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Wade Darrin Davids in court.  Attorney Helmi Hamad in court for Wade Darrin Davids.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.
Defense counsel communicated with the Court requesting an adjournment. Court granted the defenses request. Case adjourned to Branch 17.

Correspondence with parties. Due to court congestion this case is re-scheduled for an initial appearance on 10/24/2022 at 10:45 am. Case adjourned to Br 17.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Wade Darrin Davids in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Wade Darrin Davids appeared by video means.
Defense requested an adjournment due to reasons on the record. Court granted the defenses request. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Received and Filed. Addendum To Plea Form

Court received a request from defense to reschedule the intial appearance. Court granted the request and rescheduled the hearing with parties via email correspondence. Case rescheduled for a initial appearance to August 16th, 2022 at 10:50 am.
